properties.headline: Winter Storm Warning issued January 18 at 3:11PM EST until January 19 at 12:00PM EST by NWS Gray ME
properties.description:
...Widespread snowfall to impact the region tonight into Sunday
morning...

.Area of low pressure will move northeastward along the coast
tonight into Sunday. Periods of moderate to locally heavy
snowfall rates are possible overnight with reduced visibility and
dangerous travel conditions. Snow may mix with rain along the New
Hampshire and Maine coastlines before rapidly ending early Sunday
morning.

* WHAT...Heavy snow expected. Total snow accumulations of 5 to 7
inches expected.

* WHERE...Portions of south central, southwest and western Maine.

* WHEN...From 6 PM this evening to noon EST Sunday.

* IMPACTS...Travel could be very difficult.

* ADDITIONAL DETAILS...Locally moderate to heavy snowfall rates
this evening and overnight will result in rapidly changing
travel conditions and reduced visibility.
properties.instruction:
If you must travel, keep an extra flashlight, food, and water in
your vehicle in case of an emergency.

For a more precise forecast for your specific location...go to
www.weather.gov/gray..

NWSheadline: WINTER STORM WARNING IN EFFECT FROM 6 PM THIS EVENING TO NOON EST SUNDAY
